metadata.synopsis: Eighty-year-old Jiri seeks revenge on the former SS officer who executed his parents. When he meets the man's son, the pair journey to meet surviving witnesses of war.

reviews: A film that directly impacts the viewer's heart, speaking of forgiveness and recognition of the victims through a road movie. [Full review in Spanish]
Nothing funny remains in an outcome that strangely denies the need for forgiveness that it has defended before. [Full review in Spanish]
Without looking for greatness or great epic pretexts, it ends with the same naturalness with which it begins. [Full Review in Spanish]
For the most part this is a lyrical and lightly handled odd couple road movie that achieves a subtle resonance, although it is almost scuppered by a sudden major tonal shift in the film's final act.

The subtlety of the film's elegant craft, the restraint of ulk's characterful screenplay, and the superb chemistry between the two lead actors ... gives "The Interpreter" a respectful, quiet resonance.
Despite the teaming of Peter Simonischek and Jiř Menzel as the unlikely travelling companions, this follow up to the director's 2011 drama Gypsy disappoints.
A trip worth taking - except for that one twist.
